subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: After 35 years, the former Pirates star pitcher Steve Blass regained his control, but in a different game. Blass, whose career ended in 1974 when he inexplicably lost his ability to throw the ball over the plate, made two holes in one in a span of 11 holes during the team’s annual alumni golf outing. Golf Digest estimates the odds against having two holes in one during the same round are 67 million to 1.
